question_sentence: This week kicked off a solid start to the holiday shopping season. Following Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which was observed on Tuesday?
evidence: After snagging major deals, many shoppers participated in Giving Tuesday – a day of heightened generosity when people give to their favorite charities. About $3.1 billion dollars was raised for various causes this year, according to GivingTuesday.org.

question_sentence: What caused delays and headaches for millions of travelers across the US this week?
evidence: A severe storm system delayed thousands of flights as many people tried to fly back from their Thanksgiving destinations. A “particularly dangerous situation” tornado watch was also in effect for parts of three southern states.

question_sentence: Unprecedented protests over Covid-19 lockdowns recently took place in which country?
evidence: Thousands of people in China took to the streets in a rare show of dissent against the ruling Communist Party over its zero-Covid policies. Some have even called for the resignation of Chinese leader Xi Jinping.

question_sentence: The Senate on Tuesday passed legislation to protect same-sex and interracial marriage. How many Republicans supported the bill?
evidence: The bill was supported by all members of the Democratic caucus and 12 Republicans, the same dozen GOP members who backed the bill for a procedural vote earlier this month. The final vote was 61-36.

question_sentence: Which city issued a boil water notice to millions of its residents due to a loss of pressure at a purification plant?
evidence: City officials in Houston this week said water for drinking, cooking, washing hands and faces and brushing teeth should be boiled before use to destroy all potentially harmful bacteria and other microbes. The notice was lifted on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which country did the US Men’s National Team recently defeat in a high-stakes World Cup match?
evidence: The US advanced to the knockout stage after a hard-fought victory against Iran this week.

question_sentence: The world’s largest active volcano is erupting for the first time in nearly 40 years. Where is it located?
evidence: The Mauna Loa volcano is erupting on Hawaii’s Big Island. There is no threat to property, but state health officials have warned about potential air quality issues, including vog, or volcanic smog.

question_sentence: Which word did Merriam-Webster select as its 2022 word of the year?
evidence: The online dictionary chose the word “gaslighting,” which defines as “the act or practice of grossly misleading someone especially for one’s own advantage.”

question_sentence: Which global leader did President Joe Biden welcome to the White House this week for his first state visit since taking office?
evidence: French President Emmanuel Macron and his spouse, Brigitte Macron, arrived at the White House Thursday for a state visit. The Macrons’ trip to the White House marks their second time as the guests of honor for a state visit, having first done so during former President Donald Trump’s administration in 2018.

question_sentence: Which luxury fashion brand faced widespread criticism for publishing a controversial photo campaign involving children?
evidence: A Balenciaga photo shoot caused uproar for featuring children in a disturbing advertising campaign. Several high-profile celebrities are now reconsidering their working relationships with the brand.

question_sentence: This luxury fashion house drew backlash for referencing child porn and featuring child models alongside fetish imagery in a recent ad campaign:
Hawaii’s Mauna Loa, the largest active volcano in the world erupted this week for the first time since:
A Florida woman filed a class action lawsuit against Kraft Heinz Foods Company, alleging what about its Velveeta Shells & Cheese?
choices: It takes longer than advertised to prepare
The cheese doesn't stick to the shells

question_sentence: Protesters in Shanghai called for the removal of Chinese President Xi Jinping and clashed with police over policy relating to:
Which of these foods received UN world heritage status this week?
On Saturday, Michigan football defeated Ohio State in Columbus for the first time since:
Democratic Rep. Hakeem Jeffries will be the first Black lawmaker to lead a major party in Congress. He is a representative for which state?
Christine McVie, the British keyboard player and co-vocalist in Fleetwood Mac, died Wednesday at age 79. When did she join Fleetwood Mac?
South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem issued an executive order blocking the download of which app from state devices?
To avoid a strike that President Joe Biden warned would decimate the economy, Congress voted to impose a labor deal for which industry?
Which former Labour heavyweight hinted at a return to frontline politics during an interview with Andrew Marr?
evidence: It’s been more than a decade since David Miliband narrowly lost his bid for the Labour Party leadership to his brother, Ed.

question_sentence: According to the latest census data, what percentage of people in England and Wales consider themselves to have ‘no religion’?
evidence: The 2021 census also revealed that the proportion of people in England and Wales who describe themselves as Christian has fallen below 50% for the first time.

question_sentence: Why did four monks leave a Buddhist temple in Thailand this week?
choices: They had unauthorised visitors to stay
evidence: The monks tested positive for methamphetamine and were sent to a nearby clinic to undergo drug rehabilitation. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: According to British Poultry Council figures, how many free range turkeys and geese have been culled or died as a result of avian flu?
evidence: It was reported this week that almost half of the UK’s 1.3 million free range birds have been lost to avian flu.

question_sentence: Which classic video game turned 50 years old this week?
evidence: Pong, which would become the first commercially successful video game, was released by gaming giant Atari half a century ago.

question_sentence: The first by-election since the resignation of Boris Johnson and Liz Truss took place in Chester following the resignation of which Labour MP?
evidence: Labour held the seat with Samantha Dixon securing 61% of the votes. Chris Matheson resigned in October following allegations of sexual misconduct.

question_sentence: The UK’s most senior police officer of colour compared which Conservative Party cabinet member’s remarks about immigration to Enoch Powell’s views?
evidence: Neil Basu, who is stepping down after 30 years with the Metropolitan Police, told Channel 4 News that the home secretary’s vocabulary was ‘inexplicable’ and ‘horrific’.

question_sentence: A study found that Brexit has contributed to record price inflation, adding roughly how much to household food bills over the two years to the end of 2021?
evidence: The study by LSE researchers found that costs associated with leaving the EU had added 3% a year to UK food prices.

question_sentence: Which world-famous singer apologised after using a machine to produce ‘hand-signed’ copies of his new book?
evidence: Fans who had purchased limited-edition copies of Bob Dylan’s new book, The Philosophy of Modern Song, noticed the signatures were identical after comparing photographs online.

question_sentence: Christine McVie died this week aged 79. Which of these Fleetwood Mac hits did she not write?
evidence: The British-born singer-songwriter was the band’s ‘biggest hitmaker’ who also wrote You Make Loving Fun and Everywhere.
